Experience Multiple Subject Teaching Credential Candidate CalStateTEACH August 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Monterey Bay Elementary student teacher in Alameda County School District -Title 1, 4th grade setting - 30 students. Prior term - 1st grade, non Title 1 environment. 445 hours for student teaching. Used G.L.A.D. techniques to teach a balanced literacy approach for visual, tactile, and auditory learners. Administered and analyzed weekly student assessments. Helped struggling English Learners and Native English speakers through various intervention strategies. Some strategies used: echo; choral and guided reading for students struggling with reading comprehension; one on one, small, and whole group tutoring; peer scaffolding; modeling differences between word by word reading and fluent phrasing; and providing students support, encouragement and extra time on tests when needed. Maintained a classroom environment that fostered all inclusive learning. Developed positive relationships with parents, students and staff.  
 
Illuminate software; Engrade; Smartboard; PowerPoint; Microsoft Word; Microsoft Excel; scanning; copier; lesson creation and implementation; small group tutoring; One on One tutoring; Reading/Math assessments; Common Core; Multisubject Instruction; Behavioral Management; Guided Reading; G.L.A.D. Techniques; P21 skills; Common Core & State Standards; Running Records and Miscue analysis; Rubric scale; Comprehensive Literacy Study CaseReports; Effectively maintain student interest and provided interactive atmosphere which enabled students to help become the best they can be. Instilled the love of learning for all multisubjects, especially math and reading.  
 
Assessments used to support my students learning: Oral Language Survey; Reading Interests and attitudes; Graded word tests; Handwriting and spelling analysis; Reading comprehension; narrative and expository text; San Diego Quick Test; Elementary Spelling Inventory; Attitude and Interest Survey; Fluency; and Math.  
 
Passed TPA 1 with a 3 and TPA 2 with a 4.
